paragraphs.content: Chapter 2
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 2

paragraphs.content: My brethren, have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory, with respect of persons.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My brethren, have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory, with respect of persons.

paragraphs.content: For if there come unto your assembly a man with a gold ring, in goodly apparel, and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment;
paragraphs.contentHtml: For if there come unto your assembly a man with a gold ring, in goodly apparel, and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment;

paragraphs.content: And ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing, and say unto him, Sit thou here in a good place; and say to the poor, Stand thou there, or sit here under my footstool:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing, and say unto him, Sit thou here in a good place; and say to the poor, Stand thou there, or sit here under my footstool:

paragraphs.content: Are ye not then partial in yourselves, and are become judges of evil thoughts?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Are ye not then partial in yourselves, and are become judges of evil thoughts?

paragraphs.content: Hearken, my beloved brethren, Hath not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith, and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hearken, my beloved brethren, Hath not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith, and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him?

paragraphs.content: But ye have despised the poor. Do not rich men oppress you, and draw you before the judgment seats?
paragraphs.contentHtml: But ye have despised the poor. Do not rich men oppress you, and draw you before the judgment seats?

paragraphs.content: Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called?

paragraphs.content: If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well:
paragraphs.contentHtml: If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well:

paragraphs.content: But if ye have respect to persons, ye commit sin, and are convinced of the law as transgressors.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But if ye have respect to persons, ye commit sin, and are convinced of the law as transgressors.

paragraphs.content: For whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in one point, he is guilty of all.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in one point, he is guilty of all.

paragraphs.content: For he that said, Do not commit adultery, said also, Do not kill. Now if thou commit no adultery, yet if thou kill, thou art become a transgressor of the law.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he that said, Do not commit adultery, said also, Do not kill. Now if thou commit no adultery, yet if thou kill, thou art become a transgressor of the law.

paragraphs.content: So speak ye, and so do, as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So speak ye, and so do, as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty.

paragraphs.content: For he shall have judgment without mercy, that hath shewed no mercy; and mercy rejoiceth against judgment.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he shall have judgment without mercy, that hath shewed no mercy; and mercy rejoiceth against judgment.

paragraphs.content: What doth it profit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith, and have not works? can faith save him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: What doth it profit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith, and have not works? can faith save him?

paragraphs.content: If a brother or sister be naked, and destitute of daily food,
paragraphs.contentHtml: If a brother or sister be naked, and destitute of daily food,

paragraphs.content: And one of you say unto them, Depart in peace, be ye warmed and filled; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body; what doth it profit?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And one of you say unto them, Depart in peace, be ye warmed and filled; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body; what doth it profit?

paragraphs.content: Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.

paragraphs.content: Yea, a man may say, Thou hast faith, and I have works: shew me thy faith without thy works, and I will shew thee my faith by my works.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, a man may say, Thou hast faith, and I have works: shew me thy faith without thy works, and I will shew thee my faith by my works.

paragraphs.content: Thou believest that there is one God; thou doest well: the devils also believe, and tremble.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou believest that there is one God; thou doest well: the devils also believe, and tremble.

paragraphs.content: But wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead?
paragraphs.contentHtml: But wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead?

paragraphs.content: Was not Abraham our father justified by works, when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Was not Abraham our father justified by works, when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar?

paragraphs.content: Seest thou how faith wrought with his works, and by works was faith made perfect?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Seest thou how faith wrought with his works, and by works was faith made perfect?

paragraphs.content: And the scripture was fulfilled which saith, Abraham believed God, and it was imputed unto him for righteousness: and he was called the Friend of God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the scripture was fulfilled which saith, Abraham believed God, and it was imputed unto him for righteousness: and he was called the Friend of God.

paragraphs.content: Ye see then how that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ye see then how that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.

paragraphs.content: Likewise also was not Rahab the harlot justified by works, when she had received the messengers, and had sent them out another way?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Likewise also was not Rahab the harlot justified by works, when she had received the messengers, and had sent them out another way?

paragraphs.content: For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead also.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead also.
